page.title: 03Mentmore Village
page.content: The majority of dwellings in Mentmore village were built as estate cottages by the de Rothschild family in the late 19th century, in the distinctive Rothschild style of stuccoed brick with black painted timber mock-Tudor facings. No new building was allowed until after the sale of Mentmore Towers estate, and most houses are now privately owned. Approaching from the Wing Road we find one house and a cottage on the left, in what was formerly the estate woodyard.Buildings there became the Gas House to supply gas to the mansion, then were conver- ted to supply electricity and finally became estate garages. The Coronation Coach was kept there for safety during the 1939-1945 war. These buildings are currently being converted to houses. The cricket ground and pavillion are further down the slope on the left.
